alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 27 at 10:54AM CDT until August 28 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River Near Holden affecting Livingston Parish. For the Tickfaw River...including Holden...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tickfaw River Near Holden. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Wooded areas in the vicinity of the Highway 190 bridge will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CDT Saturday was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 04/15/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
